title: [ENH] AutoETS: heavy random fluctuations in interval predictions - investigate random seed and correctness
body:
Update by @fkiraly: the below is not a bug, but a consequence of what seems like quite serious random variation in the prediction intervals and quantiles produced by `AutoETS`.

It may be useful to investigate whether:
* a random seed can be set in `AutoETS` to allow deterministic comparisons
* whether the prediction intervals should be something different (e.g., variation predicted added to variation in re-sampling the prediction)
* whether this fluctuation implies anything about the correctness of `AutoETS`

---

**Describe the bug**

Followup from ##2275: AutoETS behavior still seems inconsistent in the 0.11.0 release (ARIMA and Theta has to be fixed now).

**To Reproduce**

```python
from sktime.datasets import load_airline
from sktime.forecasting.ets import AutoETS
y = load_airline()

forecaster = AutoETS(auto=True, n_jobs=-1, sp=12)
forecaster.fit(y, fh=[1,2,3])

# return_pred_int and alpha are disabled in sktime 0.11.0
# forecaster.predict(return_pred_int=True, alpha=0.05)
forecaster.predict()

forecaster.predict_quantiles(alpha=[0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.5, 0.9, 0.95, 0.975])

forecaster.predict_interval(coverage=[0.8, 0.9, 0.95])
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/160263672-3deed4ef-41cb-423a-9218-cab02994230b.png)



**Expected behavior**
Would have expected the point forecast to match 50% quantile and coverage = 80% to match quantiles [0.1, 0.9] and so on. This seems to be the case in ARIMA and ThetaForecaster but not in AutoETS.
